title: Herblore

properties.name: description
properties.value: Herblore is a members-only skill that allows players to make their own potions from herbs and various secondary ingredients.

Calculators determine experience and costs based on real-time prices from the Grand Exchange Market Watch.
This article is about the Herblore skill. For information on training Herblore, see Herblore training.
For a list of all requirements and unlockables within the Herblore skill, see Herblore/Level up table.
Herblore
Released 27 February 2002 (Update)
Also called Herb
Members Yes
Type Artisan
Statistics

99 		61,869
as of 1 May 2022 - update
Players with
200M XP 		177
as of 1 April 2022 - update

Herblore is a members-only skill that allows players to make their own potions from herbs and various secondary ingredients.

Potions created with the Herblore skill have a variety of effects. Most potions can be drunk to give players temporary skill boosts or other status effects, such as anti-fire or anti-poison. Effects of temporary skill boosts degrade at roughly 1 level per minute until they have entirely worn off.

Herblore level up - normal
The music that plays when levelling up.
Herblore level up - with unlocks
The music that plays when levelling up and unlocking new content.

Requirements[edit | edit source]

Training Herblore or obtaining a temporary boost requires completion of the Druidic Ritual quest. Upon completing this quest, players are rewarded with 250 Herblore experience, granting them level 3 in Herblore. From level 3 onwards, players will be able to train Herblore by creating potions.

Training activities[edit | edit source]

There are roughly four methods to train Herblore: by cleaning herbs, making potions, adding herbs to swamp tar and making barbarian potions.

Cleaning herbs & unfinished potions[edit | edit source]

Cleaning herbs is a simple task you have to perform before you can add a herb to a vial of water to create an unfinished potion.

For information about the cost/profit on cleaning herbs or creating unfinished potions, see Calculator:Herblore/Herbs

Potions[edit | edit source]

Potions act as a temporary skill boost. Once you add a herb to a vial of water, you get an unfinished potion; then, you must add a secondary ingredient to finish the potion completely. A newly finished vial of potion contains three (3) doses of the potion. Some higher-level potions require a vial of coconut milk to be used instead of water.

Wearing an amulet of chemistry gives a 5% chance of creating a four (4) dose potion instead. This can be useful for conserving resources on Ironman accounts or for potions with rare or expensive ingredients.

For information about the cost per experience, see Calculator:Herblore/Potions

All swamp tar require a pestle and mortar to make.

44 Harralander tar 72.5 Harralander Swamp tar 15 Ammo for black salamanders.

Barbarian Mixes[edit | edit source]

Main article: Barbarian Herblore

Barbarian potions can be made by adding roe or caviar to two-dose potions. The barbarian potions will hold two doses that give the same effect as their regular counterparts, as well as restore 3 to 6 Hitpoints per dose.

Each potion must be mixed individually, there is no make-all option, making it much more focus intensive. Additionally, the default left-click option for roe and caviar is "eat", not "use", making it possible to consume the ingredients instead of using them.

Temporary boosts[edit | edit source]

Main article: Temporary skill boost

Herblore cannot be boosted before completing Druidic Ritual; attempting to use such an item will consume it and give the message "Your lack of Herblore experience prevents you from gaining any further bonus."

Boost Level
increase 		Visibility Other info
Herblore cape 1 Visible Activating the cape's effect will increase the corresponding skill by 1.
Greenman's ale 1 Visible Reduces Attack, Strength and Defence by 2 or more.
Mature Greenman's ale 2 Visible Reduces Attack, Strength and Defence by 2 or more.
Botanical pie 4 Visible Consists of 2 bites, restoring 7 Hitpoints per bite.
Spicy stew
(brown spice) 		0-5 Visible Depending on type of stew, any skill can be boosted or reduced by 0 to 5 levels randomly.

Skill choice[edit | edit source]

Upon completing any of the following quests, players may choose to allocate experience to Herblore. These rewards usually come in the form of items, such as lamps or books, and are independent of any experience rewards directly received for completing the quest.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 April 2021
(update)

Some grammar has been corrected in the Herblore level-up messages.

10 September 2020
(update)

You may now clean all your herbs automatically after cleaning the first one in your Inventory.

6 January 2014
(update)

When you fail to identify a herb because your Herblore level is too low, the message no longer refers to cleaning.

14 November 2013
(update)

Some Herblore mixing animations have been updated to stop them interfering with your walk animation.

25 February 2013
(update)

The change for herbs from "unidentified" to "grimy" was reverted, by popular request.

22 February 2013
(update)
  • This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.
  • Unidentified herbs have been changed to grimy herbs.
